name: Best Actor in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: Paul Newman was not present at the awards ceremony. Robert Wise accepted the award on his behalf. Newman became the fourth actor (after Al Pacino) to be twice nominated for an Oscar for portraying the same character; he had previously portrayed Fast Eddie Felson in The Hustler (1961). He also became the first actor to win an Oscar under such circumstances.

name: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role

candidates.notes: Co-presenter Sigourney Weaver accepted the award on Caine's behalf, as he could not attend the ceremony due to production on Jaws: The Revenge (1987). Caine later said of the poorly-received third sequel to Jaws (1975), "I have never seen it, but by all accounts it is terrible. However, I have seen the house that it built, and it is terrific."

candidates.notes: Ruth Prawer Jhabvala was not present at the awards ceremony. James Ivory accepted the award on her behalf.
